runs.comm: full at middle and off, neatly flicked away through straight midwicket...nice piece of timing to start with
very full, slips down past leg stump and called wide
full outside off, 142mph, he walks into a drive which finds mid-off
driven on the up this time, behind square on the off side, but backward point is able to cut it off
keeps it full outside off, not much footwork as he drives and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
that's trademark Finch, a punchy, lofted straight drive to a pretty good delivery - at 146kph and just back of a length - and it goes a couple of bounces over the rope
good comeback, a yorker, dug out back to the bowler
nice placement, comes onto the front foot and drives square through the overs...finds the gap wide if point
short ball outside off, angled across, Khawaja goes for the pull and is beaten on the under edge as the ball dies somewhat off the surface
same again, almost identical as Abbott bangs it in back of a length and Khawaja is defeat by the slowness off the surface...goes on the second bounce to de Kock
three strikes, but he isn't out...angled across, back of a length outside off, Khawaja wafting at a lot of fresh air at the moment
fuller this time, outside off, he drives away from his body and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
goes down the pitch and across the pitch, Abbott is back of a length and Finch pulls into the leg side without any timing
this time he clears the boundary! Takes this delivery, which is full outside off, over wide mid-on as the bottom hand comes into play and the bat face closes. Good connection
back of a length, Finch adjusts and taps into the covers
full outside off, clubbed towards mid-on who is deep enough to allow the single
short at the body, he pulls sweetly off his hip but Tahir does well at short fine-leg to cut off what would have been a certain boundary
picks him out! Deep square leg barely had to move...a short ball, Khawaja went for the pull and didn't try to keep it down. A lot of effort for not much reward in that stay. Neat catch by Wiese
very full outside off, 151kph and does Warner for pace as he jabs over the top of the delivery. Good wheels from Rabada
flicked away from outside off behind square on the leg side
throws his hands through this, wide outside off, no holding back and Warner was able to free his arms over point
back of a length outside off, Warner steps back towards leg stump and thumps this towards mid-off
tucked into the leg side to deep square
driven on the up to cover
back of a length outside off, Finch stands tall and punches to the left of mid-off
round the wicket and that's deposited over deep midwicket, Finch goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps with terrific power which overcame the fact it came high off the bat
that's huge again! The spectators at deep midwicket in danger. It's a quicker, shorter, delivery which Finch rocks back to and pulls high and handsome
three in a row! Hold on, folks. This is an awful full toss which Finch dispatches into the stands over deep midwicket again
almost six, just a few meters short...Duminy fired it miles outside off, Finch did very well to even reach the ball and someone manages to flat-bat it over cover
quick and slung in towards leg stump, he goes for the sweep and gets taken on the pad. A dot ball.

wide outside off again, Finch giving himself room to the leg side but again manages to reach the ball with the toe end of the bat. Gets enough on it to clear mid-off. That might be Duminy done for the day
short of a length and that's a very nice piece of placement from Warner as he flips it off his hip backward of square on the leg side
comes round the wicket, back of a length outside off, crunched to cover
gets this over mid-off, it's a touch fuller from Morris, Warner stays in his crease and just drills through the line to comfortably clear the in-field
not far away from dragging this on as Morris goes shorter, Warner pulls and gets a thick bottom edge which puts backspin on the ball and nearly sees it roll into the stumps
this goes very high, and has the distance as well...back of a length, Warner pulls off the front foot, the angle is coming into him from round the wicket and clears deep midwicket
down the pitch, he's on one leg when he cracks this to cover

strikes first ball! Over the wicket, short of a length outside off, and Warner ends up steering this straight to backward point where Duminy takes a good low catch. He went for placement rather than brute force this time
full outside off, Smith comes forward and defends to the covers
keeps it full, Smith gently pushes to back past the bowler towards long off
driven on the up to the cover sweeper...South Africa able to spread the field now
goes across his stumps, you can see all three behind him, whips this to midwicket
outside off, pushed into the covers...that's a good over from Wiese to calm things down a touch
would you believe it! Starts with a filthy full toss outside off which Finch plants straight to deep midwicket. The mood is with Tahir in recent weeks
is that a chance?! A lovely delivery, grips from middle and leg, spins to take the edge and, yes, that is a drop by de Kock behind the stumps
fuller, shovelled into the leg side towards midwicket where, with a clean piece of fielding, it could have been tight
uses his feet, comes down outside off stump and flicks to midwicket
short outside off, opens the face and guides to point which is well protected
full at middle, pushed back down the pitch where Tahir fields to finish a terrific opening over
that's wonderful batting, it was a short delivery outside off stump but the timing and placement was top class from Maxwell as he goes onto his toes and opens the face through backward point
tighter to the body, flicked through square leg
a slower ball, full outside off, steered down to third man
taken from outside off into the leg side towards long on
back of a length, outside off, Smith well across his crease and pushes it back to Wiese
more good stuff from Wiese, just outside off, not much width, Smith punches it square to point
clips a low full toss along the ground to long on
some swift footwork from Smith as he flicks it along the ground through midwicket
has a mighty swipe at this delivery outside off, doesn't make contact and it beats de Kock to escape for byes towards third man
nudged into the leg side, plenty of space at midwicket and Tahir chases it himself
pushed down the ground to long on
dragged down a touch short, he rocks back and pulls strong to bisect deep midwicket and long on
drives and misses at a full ball outside off, Smith struggling to get going at the moment
terrific bowling, spearing in full at the stumps, Smith falls across as he tries to work it away and gets a thick inside edge into his pads
the frustration growing for Smith as he has a wild heave to a full delivery outside off and almost swings himself off his feet
holds his shape this time, flicks it from well outside off through midwicket and places it nicely for a brace
and he's edged it! A very tame dismissal. A short delivery which he was trying to guide to third man - another cutter from Wiese, dragged a long way down - and it takes a top edge through to de Kock
short and pulled through midwicket
full at the stumps, driven straight and this strikes the umpire on his thigh as he tries to get out of the way
poor delivery, angled onto leg stump and that's neatly tickled away to fine leg

huge wicket! Short of a length works again. Maxwell standing on leg stump, tries to give himself room to go over the off side but ends up carving high into the air and du Plessis snaffles the catch just outside the fielding circle
full at the stumps, driven into his boot and it bobbles to the off side...almost a mix-up in the running and Marsh has to turn then dives back as Morris collects in his follow through
short on leg stump, pulled down to long leg
drives and finds backward point as the pressure increases on Australia
tight on off stump, angled into Marsh, played back to the bowler
fuller this time, aims to work into the leg side but gets an inside edge into his boot
shorter this time, another cutter I think, pulled firmly through the leg side but deep midwicket keeps it to a single
length ball outside off, 133kph, he opens the face and backward point can't quite cut it off with a dive
digs out a yorker down the ground to long on
full and straight, the bottom hand comes into play as he finds long on
flicked through the leg side and nicely placed between deep square and deep midwicket

and he has another! Nevill going right back in his crease, the ball appeared to strike in line with leg stump. Will be interesting to see a replay of that one. A typically full-throated appeal from Tahir and to his delight the finger goes up

beaten with a googly and there's a stumping appeal! Lovely piece of bowling, Hastings completely defeated, didn't pick it at all, and swift glovework from de Kock to get the bails off. It's gone upstairs. He has dragged his foot out, is it still in the air over the line? This is very tight. We've gone to stumpcam now. Millimetres (or a frame) in it. Benefit of the doubt? A long look from the third umpire. When is the bail out of the groove? And he survives!
drifts onto leg stump and Hastings flicks it away very fine for a welcome boundary
shorter this time, goes onto the back foot, comes off the surface very slowly and fiddled to the leg side
nearly a return catch! Driven to the off side of the pitch and Tahir flings himself to his left. Would have been spectacular
flicked out to deep midwicket
full and straight, dug out down the ground
back of a length, tight to the batsman who can only push to the off side
a yorker, excellent from Rabada, jabbed off the toe end into the covers
back-of-a-length slower ball outside off, dabbed towards backward point
another slower ball, 109kph, dragged down short and Hastings is through his shot before the ball arrives
pushed away from around leg stump into the covers
that was on the cards...a massive heave at another googly, could have driven a bus between the gap Hastings left as he swung, and the stumps are demolished
playing off the back foot, got to be careful, this skids on and he defends to mid-on
that's a legspinner outside off, cut towards backward point
full outside off, driven through the covers and there risk a second to the sweeper...if Tahir had taken that at the stumps it could have been close
pushed into the covers to keep the strike
forced into the leg side, they thought of a second but deep midwicket quickly in
short again, angled into leg stump, not much pace to work with off the pitch as he tries to pull
manages to connect cleanly this time, gets underneath the short delivery this time and is able to get the elevation to clear deep square leg with a pull
goes to a fuller length, at the stumps, clubbed down the ground
back of a length, jars the splice as Coulter-Nile goes for the pull and can only find midwicket
that's big! Onto the roof at deep midwicket and that ball is staying up there. A slower short delivery which he picked nearly and clubbed mightily over the leg-side boundary
full and straight, driven into the off side
back of a length, he swings to the leg side and gets a bottom edge past the stumps then a throw at the stumps - when the batsman was perfectly safe - ricochets away for a single
short, angled into the leg stump, a slower ball and pulled away wide of short fine leg...not a great delivery
and a full toss outside off is launched high and wide of long on...that's some power from Marsh who gave himself a solid base to strike through the line
gets it on target this time, full at leg stump, driven down the ground and a fumble at long on allows them back for a second
full and very wide, would have been a wide if he hadn't chased it, gets a bottom edge towards the keeper
short at leg stump, gets inside the line and paddles it round the corner to fine leg
clubbed into the leg side, doesn't come out of the middle and lands short of deep midwicket
swing and a miss as he heaves across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery
terrific bowling, that's the model of a leg-stump yorker...NCN gives himself some room, can't make contact and Rabada is right on target
gets a bouncer first up, 147kph, he ducks and it's called wide so a bonus delivery
back of a length at off stump, very nicely played through point as he opens the face and uses Rabada's pace
gives himself a touch of room outside leg then misses his swing at a length delivery outside off
width outside off, again it might have been a wide, a bottom edge scuttles through to de Kock
low full toss which he lofts straight down the ground, splits long off and long on
short outside off, another cutter, and it gets flat-batted straight to long off where Miller takes the simple catch
just shaves past off stump as Abbott goes full and Zampa misses
beaten again, this time the full delivery tails in and goes between Zampa's leg stump and his pads
full and wide outside off, squeeze away through backward point and Wiese just manages to cut off the boundary
